alert.note: Alert for Durham; Granville (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 3:32AM EST until February 07 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...A period of light freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Granville and Durham Counties. * WHEN...Through 10 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of light freezing rain is expected from just before sunrise through mid-morning Monday before changing over to all rain. The areas most likely to see freezing rain will be along and north of I-85 and the Triad region. There, a very light glaze of ice is possible on tree tops, bridges and elevated roads. Some bridges could become slick in spots. Monday morning commuters should allow extra travel time.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for North Carolina can be obtained by visiting DriveNC.gov.
